newsitem.title: GREECE: PRESS DIGEST - GREEK GENERAL NEWS- JAN 27.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - GREEK GENERAL NEWS- JAN 27.

text.p: Leading stories in the Greek general press:
--Tomorrow sees the beginning of the second round of farmers' protests with rallies, and occupation of public buildings on Wednesday, to be followed by road blocks.

--Six people have been arrested in the kidnapping of a six-year-old girl in Crete. Eleni Loulaki was found safe late last night after police raided a house 500 metres from her home in Iraklion. Head of the gang is reported to be Loulaki's father's former accountant.

--'Three-speed' degrees will be the norm at Greek universities in 2000, according to new statements from Education Minister Gerasimos Arsenis over the weekend. Entry will be easier, graduating harder.
--Six major changes will be implemented at senior high schools as of the new school year, including more emphasis on vocational courses, different teaching methods and grading.
--Friends of the family are the suspected kidnappers of young Eleni Loulaki, according to reports. --Maria Petrakis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
